page.shortlink: api sql namespace result set object execute post process function
page.description: Execute portable SQL against a *[xb:SQL::ResultSet]*, Allows for filtering after fetching a result set.
page.prototype: Result as L = ExecutePostProcess(ResultSet BYREF as SQL::ResultSet, selectStatement as c [,args as sql::Arguments])

argument.name: ResultSet
argument.description: A result set that will be populated with the results of the query.

argument.name: args
argument.description: Arguments used in the SQL statement.

return.name: Result
return.description: Returns *[xb:.T.]* if the operation succeeds. Otherwise *[xb:.F.]*. If the operation fails, additional information can be found in the *[xb:SQL::ResultSet]*'s *[xb:CallResult]* property.

discussion.p: The *[xb:SQL::ResultSet::ExecutePostProcess]* method can be used to execute a SQL query against a ResultSet.
In the following example, all the customers in the Northwind database are fetched. The resulting *[xb:SQL::ResultSet]* for the query is then filtered to get the records for only customers in France.

section.example:
dim cn as sql::Connection
? cn.Open("::Name::AADemo-Northwind") = .T.
? cn.Execute("select * from customers") = .T.
dim rs as sql::ResultSet ? cn.ResultSet.ExecutePostProcess(rs,"select distinct city from customers where country = 'France' order by city") = .T.
? rs.ToString() = Lille Lyon Marseille Nantes Paris Reims Strasbourg Toulouse Versailles
